intro: Genista cephalantha var. valdespinulosa, commonly known as the Valdespinulosa bursaria, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its shrub-like growth habit and evergreen foliage make it a distinctive feature in its natural habitat. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
